And that a instrument we -- I would say, historically, we would have said kind of 2.5% to 3% escalators and typically the bigger the tenant and the longer the lease makes sense, they would negotiate harder and you would drift to the lower end of that range and maybe a year, 18 months ago, those started moving -- itâs why we like GAAP re-leasing spreads as well because you capture that free rent and those annual bumps to 4% and it probably started in the bigger markets, but itâs been pretty consistent coming throughout the portfolio that itâs become more a 4% norm on rent escalators.
